website_summaries.verdict: Made with high-carbon steel, its stellar quality makes it worth the price for serious outdoor enthusiasts.
pros: Wood handle is carefully crafted with a straight grain
cons: Because they're handmade, some customers have received one with an off-center head

customer_reviews.title: the axe edge is crooked and skewing !!!  Worst quality in 2019
customer_reviews.text: Worst quality!!! 1.the axe edge is crooked and skewing !!! I will show u the picture , i cant beleive the most expensive GB aex like this quality. how can i use this crooked and skewing axe, i think it will totally broken if i use it in camping. 2.the handle is dark color, not good looking like your described. this is the first time i want to ruturn the product !
customer_reviews.author: TIANBIN XU

customer_reviews.title: Nice hatchet but overpriced.  Terrible customer services from Gransfors.  Go Hults Bruk instead.
customer_reviews.text: My hatchet came nicely made, no major issues except the very cheap quality sheath. It arrived with the top bit edge cutting through it. I've owned enough of these to know it comes very tight and close but this one was way too small. Contacted GB, they basically want to take zero responsibility. This is the part where you have to ask yourself, do you want to spend double on a nice axe but backed by a company with very poor customer support? Not impressed with GB trying to blame the consumer for their QC issues.
customer_reviews.author: TS

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy this from amazon or eBay.  Or GBA in general*
customer_reviews.text: ***Do not buy GBA axes from amazon!! Very disappointed in this product, bought this hatchet a couple years ago and it broke the second time I used it. I was chopping a branch off of a tree no bigger than 4 inches in diameter when the corner of the edge chipped off. I got in contact with the company and they said they will not honor the warranty if it was bought on eBay or amazon. Very disappointed and will be looking for a better hatchet with a different company since GBA sells over priced brittle junk metal.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Hudgens

customer_reviews.title: A diamond among hatchets
customer_reviews.text: Don't underestimate this little gem. It functions better then you'd think. I disregarded it for years. Reminds me very much of the small forest axe. This is built with all the care, fit and finish that my small forest axe has. This is perfect when you don't need the weight or the size of an axe. If you know how to use your tools, you'll quickly realize that this amazingly well crafted tool can handle most tasks in camp and is light enough to pack wherever you go.
customer_reviews.author: TreeBear

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: Best backpacking hatched I have ever owned. Hands down the best made, best thought out design, practical, ergonomic. Razor sharp. Awesome leather sheath. Have actually started carrying this in place of a knife, with a lightweight Mora as a backup. Seems expensive but compared to what I have paid for other hatchets this one makes the others seem like failed experiments that I wasted my money on. I am the most happy I have ever been with any hatchet, ever. Will never go back to anything other. I have used it for chopping, cutting, skinning, carving. I like it more than a knife now.
customer_reviews.author: Kazmania

customer_reviews.title: You won't be sorry if you purchase this hatchet.
customer_reviews.text: The quality is second to none. Expensive, but an heirloom to be passed down... not just any-old-hatchet. Incredible workmanship. I went back and forth trying to decide between the Hand (9.5", 1.3lbs), Small (10", .7lbs) and Wildlife (13.5", 1.3lbs) Hatchet. I wanted it to carry in my pack when hunting. Weight was a factor, but the long handle makes the Wildlife a better choice providing more power when swinging.
customer_reviews.author: JK

customer_reviews.title: Great hatchet, but I prefer the hand ax model ...
customer_reviews.text: Great hatchet, but I prefer the hand ax model with the shorter handle as it is superior for single hand use. The Wildlife hatchet's longer handle makes single hand use more difficult unless you would to modify it by adding a paracord grip closer to the ax head so you can get a solid grip when choking up. I prefer the Wildlife hatchet in the woods over the small forest ax, but not as much as I like the shorter handled hand hatchet model.
customer_reviews.author: Entropy

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this here.
customer_reviews.text: Blade alignment off from handle geometry. Completely unacceptable in an item in this price range. Was off on both my original and replacement. Makes me think these are quality rejects from GB.
customer_reviews.author: Ooro

customer_reviews.title: the balance is amazing and it's a joy to use
customer_reviews.text: Phenomenal hatchet. the balance is amazing and it's a joy to use. Please note this is an ax currently sold on amazon is from Germany, not the UK or US, and so the axe book that is included is in german. It's available as a pdf online, but if you want the actual book you can order from someone else. Also amazon's prices are not competitive on this item.
customer_reviews.author: Eric C

customer_reviews.title: Size isn’t everything.
customer_reviews.text: When you hold this hatchet you don’t just hold it. You build a bond with it a connection and you just know that when you grow out that facial hair you’ll be complete with this in your hand. BUTTTT on a serious note it’s a really good heavy duty well performing axe. Bought it for a friends birthday and well it’s a mans axe to say the least. Took it throwing a couple times and even though it’s small it feels good when throwing. It’s light and sturdy with the axe connected very well to the handle. It’s taken a lot of abuse but if you want a good quality axe for throwing this is a good one.
customer_reviews.author: Calvin Mao

customer_reviews.title: Huge disappointment
customer_reviews.text: It was with much anticipation that I opened the package containing two of these seemingly perfect hatchets. Unfortunately, upon the initial inspection of both hatchets, it was very evident that the heads were hung well off-center. When looking down the handle directly, the cutting edge does not come close to being centered. This was the case with both. At this price, "MM" and "MB" at GB should have higher standards for quality control.
customer_reviews.author: ZL

customer_reviews.title: Just like everyone else has said
customer_reviews.text: Just like everyone else has said, it is a great hatchet and comes sharp. I didn't have to clean varnish off the handle. The sheath has a welt that keeps the rivets from touching the blade and the blade from cutting the stitching, which is really nice. I bought mine for spoon carving because it's significantly less expensive than the carving hatchet. If I had it to do over again, I'd buy the carving hatchet because the bit is wider. When squaring a block of wood, mine doesn't cut the width of a block with one chop. I have to make multiple cuts to cover the width of a block. That's the only reason though.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: 2019 and quality is still good this time
customer_reviews.text: Excellent hatchet, mine came practically flawless short of a very tiny chip in the blade by the tip, minor enough it will sharpen out quickly... Started wearing a blister in pretty quickly without gloves, thinking to do some sanding and contouring... Otherwise a practically perfect hatchet, chopped through dry cedar quickly, wasn't razor sharp, but didnt take much honing to get it to cut paper.
customer_reviews.author: Aleks Kuksenko

customer_reviews.title: The nicest tool I've ever owned.
customer_reviews.text: I've had it for a year, used it to break down some tough oak with relative ease on multiple outings, and it's as razor sharp as the day I got it. The craftsmanship is unparalleled, the ergonomics are flawless, it's sharper than a knife, takes a beating, and I fully expect with some care it will be multigenerational. Hickory, steel and leather at it's best. If I chip it ever I think I'd cry.
customer_reviews.author: R. Klodginski

customer_reviews.title: Super sharp
customer_reviews.text: I received this today and it came super sharp. Cut though paper like new Morakniv. Was even able to shave some hairs with it. Even better after stropping! The head was symmetrical and the handle had no imperfections! MB was stamped on head. Name Mattias Blixt as per the booklet that came with it. He crafted a fantastic hatchet!. Glad to see they name the craftsmen who make these. Just need some green wood to try it out now. It met all my expectations!
customer_reviews.author: JKB

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Axe!!
customer_reviews.text: This hatchet is amazing! It comes literally razor sharp. I actually was able to shave with it. The handle is beautiful and extremely comfortable in the hand. The hatchet makes easy work of any wood. It chops through anything. I couldn't be happier!
customer_reviews.author: Mr. LittleJeans

customer_reviews.title: Best quality
customer_reviews.text: I own two grantors bruk axes, I love them. Excellent quality! Very sharp, and the designs are perfect for their intended purposes. The carving axe is amazing I can carve easily with it. And the small wildlife axe is great for kindling, chopping down small trees, limbing, and it's easy to carry.
customer_reviews.author: Adelaide

customer_reviews.title: An excellent axe. It came razor sharp
customer_reviews.text: An excellent axe. It came razor sharp, and the craftsmanship is exemplary. The manufacturer exercises extreme attention to detail; even the grain orientation of the handle is perfect. This axe is well worth the price and will last a lifetime.
customer_reviews.author: Doublewolf

customer_reviews.title: Pricey but you'll be happy
customer_reviews.text: I have no problem with pricey if there's quality, good craftsmanship and decent warranty, and this hatchet had it all. Great performer with a great bite, capable of tasks above it's weight class. Quality Swedish steel, great ergonomics and balance and holds the edge well after moderate usage. Recommended without reservations
customer_reviews.author: Fos

customer_reviews.title: Perfect little Hatchet.
customer_reviews.text: I have a larger Hults Burk that I have been using for carving spoons. It does a fine job but was just a little to big and causes my hand to fautigue. Decided to give the GB Wildlife hatchet a try and it’s the prefect size and weight. Sharp as he!!. Out of the box and ready to go to work.
customer_reviews.author: C. Boor

customer_reviews.title: Great Hatchet
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I had purchased a cheap hatchet at Menards and found out the hard way the cheap is NOT the way to go. We have used this for camping and general use around our property. Its a great tool, very well made. I would imagine that with the proper care and maintenance this will be the last hatchet we buy. We are considering purchasing other tools from them as well because the quality is so nice!
customer_reviews.author: Zac and Rachael Fross

customer_reviews.title: sharp and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Amazing hatchet. Very sharp, in fact I bought this for my girlfriend who on the first night of using split through a log and then into her leg causing an ER visit and eight staples. This thing is crazy sharp and she is more cautious of how she uses it now. I plan to buy more from the Gransfors Bruks line of axes, probably the small forest axe for myself, maybe even the hand axe.
customer_reviews.author: true review

customer_reviews.title: Excellent axe, better shipping packaging needed.
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful axe. Very sharp, axe head had plenty of boiled linseed oil and fitment was tight through the eye. Wooden wedge used. Axe mask is adequate leather, however I will be replacing it for a better quality set Attached Axe book was in German, or other Nordic language so I had to download a pdf of the English version. Only concern was the packaging was not in box, but in a soft sided padded mailing pouch. For an axe of this quality and expense it should be better protected for shipping.
customer_reviews.author: D. Kay

customer_reviews.title: hand made
customer_reviews.text: Have two so that should tell how I feel about them overall. Excellent feel in the hand. I'd of given 5 stars if the handle grain orientation was better. Significance of that debatable but a reason for no 5 star considering the price. Has a excellent grind. Burr left on edge, Took about 10 seconds with a fine diamond stone to shave hair off my arm.
customer_reviews.author: maddog

customer_reviews.title: Cant be compared.....
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely cant Express my love for this piece of craftsmanship! Three weeks of survival school, a mishap and nicked edge(come right out and took and held shape) and I'll had to do was strop it to keep it literally shave sharp! Everyone else used it as well, so it had basically the "abuse" of 3 ppl over a 3 week time period. If I ever have to buy another one, which I dont see I will ever have too, itll be another one of these! You get what you pay for they say but you are really getting a bargain once you realize what you have.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse

customer_reviews.title: After research on many hatchets, I found the very best one.
customer_reviews.text: Right out of the box it felt like I have held it in my hand for many years. Even with XXL size hands. I recently purchased the Scandinavian axe and this is the perfect companion to go with it. Would definitely purchase this hatchet again.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Chronic Jr.

customer_reviews.title: One of the finest tools I own.
customer_reviews.text: I love this hatchet..I love how it is rough. It is a real tool that someone will be using still a 100 years after I am dead. I hope my great great grand children will be using this one day.
customer_reviews.author: Not my name

customer_reviews.title: The best seller and product
customer_reviews.text: I’ve finally got my order from the seller Sagittarius project. After a period of 5 months due to the pandemic crisis. Out of the box the GB wildlife was amazingly sharp as it can shave of body hairs. The product is advertised a masterpiece of craftsmanship. The seller was the best among everything else . I will plan to order GB SFA again from the same seller. But recently I noticed that ‘delivery cannot be done to my address ‘ for every product on Amazon... I wonder what is the cause of this abrupt change in policy.
customer_reviews.author: kevi linyii

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tool.
customer_reviews.text: It's over a century of forging tools by hand in Sweden , they got it right... Excellent tool..
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: this is a great little axe, sharp good for ruffing out wood for spoons,and other chores.worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very nice tool
customer_reviews.text: I sent this as a gift to a good friend, who is also sort of a hatchet junkie. He spends a lot of time outdoors and actually uses his hatchets on a regular basis. He simply could not be happier with the tool. It is holding an edge nicely, and is well-balanced for splitting kindling. The sheath is actually usable. The handle is as appears in the photos, nice tight-grained wood and the handle is oil-finished, not varnished. I'll be ordering another one shortly for myself. Unfortunately, the price has gone up.
customer_reviews.author: Taildown

customer_reviews.title: What's printed in the booklet.
customer_reviews.text: The information booklet sent is not printed in English to including the yellow return sheet in the back . Are you going send it to me in English.
customer_reviews.author: don nelson

customer_reviews.title: First Class Axe
customer_reviews.text: Hatchet came a few days ago and after very close inspection and some outside testing it is damn near perfect. Shaving sharp, head shape, grain in the handle runs straight up and down, completely fills the axe eye. NO faults at all, the only thing that would make this one any better is if it was free. However at 112 dollars it is still a bargain and worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Tn John

customer_reviews.title: Bought this as a gift.. Wish it was for me!
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these for my brother as a gift. He does all kinds of crafts outdoors and everyone I talked to/searched said these were the best. Seemed a bit pricy but after holding it I can say that if it is cared for it should last forever (or at least several life times). The worst I can see is that you may have to replace the handle every 20-30 years or sooner if you are really hard on it.
customer_reviews.author: Travis R. Nichols

customer_reviews.title: Made in Sweden
customer_reviews.text: It's sturdy and I accidentally hit a knob and it bent the sharp edge. I need a file to sharp the edge again. Works great for splitting camp fire woods to make kindling and shavings.
customer_reviews.author: Parker Knight

customer_reviews.title: Axe
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a requested gift for my son who loves camping. He was happy to receive this and states it is just as described in the posting. It was received on the early end of the expected arrival date range
customer_reviews.author: Karen Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Needs improvement in quality control.
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t receive an axe with a straight axe head. Slightly warped and it shows in performance... bummed..
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Lee

customer_reviews.title: Simply the best
customer_reviews.text: Gransfors Bruks products are made by hand by Swedish craftsmen and carry a 20-year warranty on the handle. This was a gift for dad and it is a splendid little wilderness companion and tool.
customer_reviews.author: HistoryBuff

customer_reviews.title: Quality to last a lifetime
customer_reviews.text: This is the last hatchet you will ever need. I had reservations about paying this much for a hatchet but the quality and craftsmanship makes it worth it. Edge is razor sharp and easy to handle for finer work as well as basic chopping. Happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: John P

customer_reviews.title: Functional Art
customer_reviews.text: It is clear from the start that this hatchet was made with care and attention. Truly a functional piece of art that I would not hesitate to take backpacking; a word to the wise, however: do your best to keep the steel dry as it can rust along the cutting edge. Speaking of which, this hatchet came out shaving sharp. Hope to pass this down in my family!
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Linnabary

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Hatchet
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing! For my purposes, this is just the right size of hatchet. The quality and craftsmanship are unparalleled, and I imagine all of Gransfors Bruks products are as well. I highly recommend this little thing, it is a fantastic hatchet!
customer_reviews.author: Kevin C

customer_reviews.title: Best hatchet I've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: This thing lives up to the hype. It arrived razor sharp, handle is smooth and comfortable to grip. Head holds an edge better than I expected. The blade cover is resilient, and hasn't even begun to show wear from being used. Can't say enough good things about this hatchet.
customer_reviews.author: DJ

customer_reviews.title: Beautifully crafted axe
customer_reviews.text: Beautifully crafted axe. Very sharp. Took backpacking and am debating the wisdom of taking the extra weight. Not super heavy but not super light either.
customer_reviews.author: Cascadia

customer_reviews.title: Great hatchet that is properly designed and ground
customer_reviews.text: Great hatchet that is properly designed and ground. The bit was almost razor sharp. Only complaint I have was the grain in the handle is no where near correct. It runs perpendicular to the cutting edge which is crap for axes. It'll break one day.
customer_reviews.author: Tim & Allie Wilkerson

customer_reviews.title: The best
customer_reviews.text: This is a delightful ax to hold and use,Strong, sharp and comfortable I can't see how it could be any better unless it chopped the wood for me.
customer_reviews.author: 11 Bobo

customer_reviews.title: Expensive but worthit if you like fine tools
customer_reviews.text: Damn near a perfect hatchet....Has that perfect swing in hand.
customer_reviews.author: W. L. S.

customer_reviews.title: Sharp and handy
customer_reviews.text: This hatchet is undoubtedly one of the most usable tools I've owned for smaller cutting tasks. If I had my choice between a large knife and this hatchet I'd take the hatchet. It's shaving sharp on arrival and very manageable.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Love this axe
customer_reviews.text: Wildlife hatchet was well packaged. Awesome unboxing experience, light weight very well balanced axe, I use this axe mostly for small green wood carving, despite the negative comments on the fit and finish of the axe I had no problems with mine.
customer_reviews.author: Linville Hendrix

customer_reviews.title: Great Hatchet. The blade is sharp and the handle ...
customer_reviews.text: Great Hatchet. The blade is sharp and the handle extremely solid. Would like a little better sheath but it works fine.
customer_reviews.author: BamaMBA93

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected
customer_reviews.text: This little hatchet is even better than I imagined it to be! I am absolutely thrilled with every aspect. Tusen takk to Mattias Mattsson for crafting such a beautiful piece of art!
customer_reviews.author: The Last Cavalier

customer_reviews.title: Great balance
customer_reviews.text: What can you say. It's the best of the best
customer_reviews.author: tim porter

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Awesome little hatchet exceeded my expectations. Nice and tight. I like it so much I ordered the small forest axe which was a different story and was defective
customer_reviews.author: morgan karno

customer_reviews.title: the best
customer_reviews.text: Its spendy but its worth it. hand crafted. so nice
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... I can say is this hatchet is small and awesome. It is the pride of my hiking packs ...
customer_reviews.text: All I can say is this hatchet is small and awesome. It is the pride of my hiking packs and can't wait to carry it every where I go hiking. Even if I never use it I don't want to go without it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is my go to camping axe. Sharp, fairly light, POWERFUL. Be careful.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan daniels

customer_reviews.title: It was the perfect retirement gift for a mountain man
customer_reviews.text: The old man loves this axe, it came sharp as a tack right out of the box. It was the perfect retirement gift for a mountain man.
customer_reviews.author: nate

customer_reviews.title: Excellent hatchet!
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome hatchet! Not only did it arrive sharp and ready to cut, but the handle is comfortable. I put this to good use right from the start. I had to clear some trees after a big storm. With this hatchet I was easily able to cut off any branches before I broke out the chainsaw.
customer_reviews.author: Keith

customer_reviews.title: one of the best hatchets out
customer_reviews.text: Gransfors bruks is an awesome company I own three different sizes but as for the wildlife hatchet ive never handled a better hatchet in my life a little exspensive but are u looking for something you will love or something you would throw away in a year
customer_reviews.author: barry

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect!
customer_reviews.text: No doubt this is one of the best quality hatchets available. I also have the Hunters Axe and love it. I dropped one star for this reason: The Gransfors Bruks label that is stamped into the steel of the head is only partially visible...about 1/2 of it is missing. This, of course, does not affect the function of the axe but these are heirloom quality axes that I will pass on to my grandsons and I paid a ludacrus amount of money for it...would have been nice if it was perfect.
customer_reviews.author: BCVS

customer_reviews.title: Its Sharp and is amazing to hold and to own i love it best hatchet IMO..
customer_reviews.text: It was very sharp and tremendously HIGH attention to detail it cuts better than expected it is worth every penny although i would reccomend council tool velvicut bad boy axe
customer_reviews.author: Oscar

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic little hatchet. This one is actually a gift and he loved lt!. We have one and it is an awesome tool. The craftsmanship is remarkable. Everyone who enjoys hunting, fishing ,camping or enjoying the out doors should have one.
customer_reviews.author: pachygirl13

customer_reviews.title: love this little axe
customer_reviews.text: Very nice quality blade and cover. Handle is handsome and light. Really a treasure, and the charming little book that comes with it. But why is it in a language I cannot read? I tried to find the English translation online but no luck
customer_reviews.author: John F.

customer_reviews.title: It’s not just a hatchet.. it’s a family heirloom
customer_reviews.text: This is one bad hatchet. I totally love it. I gave it 5 stars simply because I thought possibly it was made by a Viking.. All joking aside this is something I hope to pass down to one of my kiddos and they will love it and use it as much as I do
customer_reviews.author: Brad Trujillo

customer_reviews.title: best hatchet
customer_reviews.text: This hatchet is a wonderful example of quality workmanship and lasting value, I can easily see my grandson giving it to his son. Perfect size for camping, small enough to use for carving, sturdy enough for almost anything. I'm totally satisfied in every way.
customer_reviews.author: Aberjoe

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful Axe
customer_reviews.text: This is one nice axe. It's reputation precedes it from previous reviews and I can say that all positive reviews are correct. It feels great in the hand and is very good around camp. Razor sharp and easily packable you just can't go wrong with this for a camp/bushcraft axe.
customer_reviews.author: A. Walters

customer_reviews.title: Sharp enough to shave with!
customer_reviews.text: Not cheap but beautiful and sharp enough to shave with!
customer_reviews.author: TVW

customer_reviews.title: yea, its that nice
customer_reviews.text: I want a larger one, then the largest one, then a carpenters one, then a broad ax, .........
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great little hatchet when used for what it is
customer_reviews.text: Great little hatchet when used for what it is. It trims, shaves, and splits kindling great. Good steel, balance, and solid. If I needed a bigger performer I wouldn't hesitate to get one larger of the family.
customer_reviews.author: wardog

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: A piece of hand crafted art beautiful yet practical it's fit and finish is phenomenal
customer_reviews.author: Ross Nichols

customer_reviews.title: B.O.B. Essential
customer_reviews.text: This Hatchet is perfect and the one 1 star review is totally wrong. This will hack a zombie's skull in half, fell a tree, or split firewood. This hatchet is a perfect example of size not mattering but what you do with it. This is worth the $100 it costs. It comes professionally sharpened and the handle is carved out of hickory (one of the toughest woods) by a professional.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Heirloom quality
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived on time and as advertised. Excellent design and construction. Perfect for back pack hatchet. Great literature included on history of the company and maintenance of axes. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: aslamtu

customer_reviews.title: Dangerously Sharp
customer_reviews.text: I am incredibly impressed with the edge! It slipped and fell 3 inches and was able to split my finger open wide. Definitely be careful with it.
customer_reviews.author: Dave M.

customer_reviews.title: Great woods mans hatchet,
customer_reviews.text: Felt great in the hand and very sharp. It is one of my most treasured tools now.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: A grand axe. Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Well made, but the quality on this axe was slightly less than the weterlings hatchet. Has a better cutting edge and feel than the Wetterlings though
customer_reviews.author: Trent Dostine

customer_reviews.title: Great hatchet for splitting or cutting small limbs
customer_reviews.text: Great hatchet for splitting or cutting small limbs. Only complaint is that the bevel is the wrong angle because it made huge nicks in the edge when I tried cutting through a log. Very disappointed in that, but love the ax overall. I will just have to fix the bevel and then it will be as good as new.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Purvis

customer_reviews.title: ... bought this as a gift and boy did he love it! It's a beautiful hatchet and you can ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift and boy did he love it! It's a beautiful hatchet and you can tell it was handcrafted with precision.
customer_reviews.author: Tara Milar

customer_reviews.title: WOW, great axe for carving spoons.
customer_reviews.text: Super sharp and well balanced. Feels great in the hand, gorgeous to look at, works like a charm.
customer_reviews.author: Zucchinimoon

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: Several cold shuts on the bit. Bit not on handle straight.
customer_reviews.author: Brent

customer_reviews.title: I don't normally write reviews, however this hatchet exhibits ...
customer_reviews.text: I don't normally write reviews, however this hatchet exhibits quality craftsmanship, received very sharp to cut paper almost as sharp as a razor, feels balanced in your hand, hope to use it in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Kawika

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: Great hatchet. Arrived razor sharp and handles pretty much any camp chore I throw at it. Quality piece of kit.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Marra

customer_reviews.title: I love it
customer_reviews.text: Haven't used it yet, but it looks and feels great!!!
customer_reviews.author: Journeyman

customer_reviews.title: Great axe, but...
customer_reviews.text: Great over all axe! However, the handle is giving off a few splinters while using. For almost $200 I expect much more than that.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome axe
customer_reviews.text: I've used this axe for the past couple years and it still works like it did on day one. Highly recommend granfors
customer_reviews.author: penname

customer_reviews.title: The Best Hatchet You'll Ever Use
customer_reviews.text: Well balanced, sharp out of sheath, beautiful wood, the nicest steel I've ever seen on a hatchet. A dream to sharpen. The quality of work of work put into this product commands respect and enables people who like to USE their tools with incredulous impunity. The Swedes got it figured out. You will be able to give this hatchet to your son some day.
customer_reviews.author: Bubba Bo Bob

customer_reviews.title: Quality and craftmanship
customer_reviews.text: It is hard to find anything as well made as this little hatchet! I plan on buying a larger axe from GB in the future! Razor sharp and perfectly balanced....this little guy makes camp chores a breeze.
customer_reviews.author: Al Errico

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality
customer_reviews.text: Great size and the old world craftsmanship has to be seen to understand. No wonder these things are soaring in value. I have this one along with a small forest axe and they are both superb. Shaving sharp out of the box is a big bonus
customer_reviews.author: K. Brock

customer_reviews.title: The weight and balance is amazing! I can cut 7-8" wood like butter without ...
customer_reviews.text: Holy hell this thing is a beast!!! I've used this to clear soft wood and hard, and I swear the edge just doesn't go. The weight and balance is amazing! I can cut 7-8" wood like butter without any fatigue. I bought 2 already and even thought the warranty is 20 YEARS I'll probably buy another!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Kwak

customer_reviews.title: Awesome quality
customer_reviews.text: Very nice hatched comes very sharp out of the box small handle nice mask.
customer_reviews.author: Alvern Trujillo

customer_reviews.title: The leather sheath disintegrated in a humid basement after the first 10 years but I couldn't wish for a better balanced light-we
customer_reviews.text: I have my Gransfors for .. 18 years (?) I left it outside by the fire, sitting next to the kindle making stump in the backyard for weeks, on top of the firewood for month but that hatchet is going and going strong. The leather sheath disintegrated in a humid basement after the first 10 years but I couldn't wish for a better balanced light-weight wood working tool. This one was bought as a present for a boy scout. He loved it.
customer_reviews.author: Bama Boy

customer_reviews.title: Best but most expensive Ax I ever owned.  Bought another.
customer_reviews.text: Sharp, Sharp, love using it. Took it to back and it cut through some split wood like butter. Need vampire killer stake, this will make in a jiffy.
customer_reviews.author: The Zeppelin

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful
customer_reviews.text: Blast to chop with. Brings out my inner Viking, use it to make kindling and smaller chopping jobs. Light weight for its sixe and has numerous applications around camp and home.
customer_reviews.author: Maurice Michiels

customer_reviews.title: I have an Ax to grind.
customer_reviews.text: Just kidding.....no problems here! Gransfors is the best Ax on the market and this is no exception. It astounds me every single time I use it just how efficient it really is. It's like a chainsaw with no chain.
customer_reviews.author: kraut

customer_reviews.title: Win!
customer_reviews.text: Great little hatchet. Sharp as a knife. Handle is great with proper orientation. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Chad

customer_reviews.title: A hit with my husband
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my husband and he loves it! High quality hatchet.
customer_reviews.author: beth

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend this product to anyone looking to own a legacy ...
customer_reviews.text: This ax has performed above all expectations. I would recommend this product to anyone looking to own a legacy tool that should be functional for generations to come.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great size. Great addition to my collection. Just love them!
customer_reviews.author: RMoran

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Best around. Buy from a big box store so the warranty is more legit.
customer_reviews.author: Andy Spoon

customer_reviews.title: Quality head, sub par handle
customer_reviews.text: Was surprised when I received the hatchet to see a chip in the handle. For the price, this should happen.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Super
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Great weight and easy to use. Nice sharp edge holds an edge . It' is a very very nice hatchet. I use it for spoon carving.
customer_reviews.author: donna m lauzon

customer_reviews.title: Great old school Hatchet
customer_reviews.text: Never had hatchet before would usually just gather wood and break it by stepping it. The hatchet came razor sharp, it feels real good in your hand and is a blast working with around the camp site chopping wood and hacking down branches.
customer_reviews.author: ecook

product_meta.title: Gransfors Bruks Wildlife Hatchet 13.50 Inch, Axe, 415
product_meta.description: The Gransfors Wildlife Hatchet is a traditional scouting and camping axe, with the same head as the Hand Hatchet but on a longer handle. This longer handle lends the axe more power, not least when felling trees. Practical for carrying in your rucksack when you need a small axe with plenty of power. The axe is capable of lopping off quite large branches or splitting small logs for the campfire. The shape of the sheath, which covers the edge and the top part of the poll, stops the axe head cutting into your rucksack. The Axe Book comes with every axe purchased from Gransfors Bruk, Made in Sweden.
feature_bullets: The Axe Book comes with every axe purchased from Gransfors Bruk, Made in Sweden.
